title: Instructional Design Scenarios for Improving Colonoscopy Performance Competency

context.prior_knowledge: No Prior Medical Knowledge or Endoscopic Equipment Operation Experience
context.additional_context: Structured curriculum for practicing clinicians to acquire colonoscopy proficiency. Features cognitive task analysis-driven content design and project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can explain 27 core elements across six categories required for colonoscopy performance: clinical knowledge, endoscope manipulation, situational awareness, strategy development, clinical reasoning, and interpersonal skills.
Learners can perform colonoscopy manipulation skills with over 80% accuracy using simulation tools.
Learners can logically describe patient status assessment and decision-making processes through real-case analysis.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
